column4: hello im installing ubuntu 10.10 on a rather old celeron, the installation goes on great but on boot it doesnt load up gui
what can i do to get it to use default video config?
unless you created an xorg.conf it should be doing that already
nope i didnt make a xorg.conf
how to let it work like it worked in the installation?
im getting this your cpu doesnt have security..bla bla the no execute thing does it affect this?
dunno, what did you do to make it act any other way?
dont know just after installing it just says it cant load up x, the log says there are screens but no usable config
are you using an s3 or via video card?
thats tough, they have among the worst & ill supported drivers :[ though ubuntu should try at least to use vesa before it gives up, i dunno what to tell you
the installation and live session works flawlessly
though i suggest filing a bug if the livecd works but the install doesn't
hmm isnt both systems the same?
nope, and i don't know what tricks the livecd might be doing, they are very close to the same though
